<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D168186D20F_HTM_FIN168186_1">
</A>
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of DBV Technologies SA
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Paris, France
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated
	statements of financial position of DBV Technologies SA and subsidiary (the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of income (loss), consolidated comprehensive income (loss), changes
	in consolidated shareholders&#146; equity, and consolidated cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management. Our responsibility is
	to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company
	Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test
	basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement
	presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements present
	fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of the Company as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, 2014 and 2015, and the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, in
	conformity with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have also
	audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, based on the criteria established in Internal
	Control &#151; Integrated Framework (2013)&nbsp;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission and our report dated April&nbsp;28, 2016 expressed an adverse opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over
	financial reporting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	/s/ Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Associ&eacute;s
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Represented by Julien Razungles
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Neuilly-sur-Seine, France
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	April&nbsp;28, 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage147"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D168186D20F_HTM_TOC">

</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D168186D20F_HTM_FIN168186_2">
</A>
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	Internal Control Over Financial Reporting
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of DBV Technologies SA
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Paris, France
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have audited DBV Technologies SA and its
	subsidiary&#146;s (the &#147;Company&#146;s&#148;) internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, based on criteria established in Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework (2013)&nbsp;issued by the Committee of
	Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. The Company&#146;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial
	reporting, included in the accompanying Management&#146;s Annual Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the Company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit. We
	do not express an opinion or any other form of assurance on management&#146;s statements included in the Management&#146;s Plan for Remediation section. We do not express an opinion or any other form of assurance on management&#146;s statements
	included in the Management&#146;s Plan for Remediation section.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting
	Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included
	obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on that risk, and performing such
	other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A company&#146;s
	internal control over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the supervision of, the company&#146;s principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, and effected by the company&#146;s
	board of directors, management, and other personnel to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting
	principles. A company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and
	dispositions of the assets of the company; (2)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards
	(&#147;IFRS&#148;) as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3)&nbsp;provide
	reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#146;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Because of the inherent limitations of internal control over financial reporting, including the possibility of collusion or improper management override of
	controls, material misstatements due to error or fraud may not be prevented or detected on a timely basis. Also, projections of any evaluation of the effectiveness of the internal control over financial reporting to future periods are subject to the
	risk that the controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A material weakness is a deficiency, or a combination of deficiencies, in internal control over financial reporting, such that there is a reasonable
	possibility that a material misstatement of the company&#146;s annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis. The following material weakness has been identified and included in management&#146;s
	assessment: the Company did not maintain adequate segregation of duties given the size of its finance and accounting team to allow for appropriate monitoring of financial reporting matters and internal control over financial reporting. The Company
	has limited accounting and financial reporting personnel and other resources with which to address its internal controls and procedures. This material weakness was considered in determining the nature, timing, and extent of audit tests applied in
	our audit of the consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, of the Company and this report does not affect our audit report on such financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In our opinion, because of the effect of the material weakness identified above on the achievement of the objectives of the control criteria, the Company has
	not maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, based on the criteria established in Internal Control &#151; Integrated Framework (2013)&nbsp;issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the
	Treadway Commission.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We have also audited, in accordance with the standards of
	the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, of the Company and our report dated April&nbsp;28, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion on
	those financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	/s/ Deloitte&nbsp;&amp; Associ&eacute;s
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Represented by Julien Razungles
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Neuilly-sur-Seine, France
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	April&nbsp;28, 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage148"></A>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE=" MARGIN-TOP:0PT ; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with IAS 1
<I>
	Presentation of Financial Statements
</I>
	(2007)&nbsp;(IAS 1), the Group, as defined in Note 2, presents a combined statement of
	other elements of comprehensive (loss).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Group does not hold any financial assets available for sale and non-current financial assets are measured at
	historical cost which approximates fair value; therefore, no change in fair value is reflected in the consolidated statement of comprehensive (loss).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<I>
	The accompanying notes form an integral part of these consolidated financial statements.
</I>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

	The accompanying notes form an integral part of these consolidated financial statements.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D168186D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<A NAME="D168186D20F_HTM_FIN168186_8">
</A>
	NOTES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Note 1: The Company
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Incorporated in 2002 under the laws
	of France, DBV Technologies S.A. (&#147;DBV Technologies,&#148; or the &#147;Company&#148;) is a clinical-stage specialty biopharmaceutical company focused on changing the field of immunotherapy, specifically in young children.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company historically marketed a ready-to-use diagnostic product to detect t cow&#146;s milk protein allergy (&#147;CMPA&#148;) in children called
	Diallertest
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Milk, which was launched in France in 2004. This product was distributed in France only, by a commercial partner, under a temporary exception status from French regulatory
	authorities which, without such temporary exception, marketing of the product would not be allowed. During the second half of 2015, the Company discontinued its commercial partnership with respect to the product and ceased selling Diallertest Milk.
	The Company does not expect to derive any revenues in 2016 from the sale of Diallertest Milk. DBV Technologies is also developing a novel technology platform called Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;. The
	Company&#146;s therapeutic approach is based on epicutaneous immunotherapy, or EPIT, a proprietary method of delivering biologically active compounds to the immune system through intact skin using Viaskin.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Peanut is the first specific immunotherapy product developed by DBV Technologies. Solid
	preclinical data have already been published. Pharmacological development was achieved through a vast network of collaborative efforts in the United States and in Europe. A tolerance study (Phase Ib) conducted in the United States demonstrated the
	safety and high level of tolerance of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Peanut in patients with peanut allergies, and the FDA granted a Fast Track designation to the product. In France, the French Health Product
	Safety Agency (Agence fran&ccedil;aise de s&eacute;curit&eacute; sanitaire des produits de sant&eacute;, AFSSAPS) authorized an efficacy study sponsored by the Paris Region Public Hospitals (Assistance Publique &#150; H&ocirc;pitaux de Paris,
	AP/HP). In 2012, an efficacy study (Phase IIb) was launched in the United States and Europe. The topline results for the studies were published during the second 2014 semester. A Phase III clinical study began during the last 2015 quarter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Milk is the second product developed in specific immunotherapy. A Phase II pilot study
	published by Dupont et al. (JACI 2010) demonstrated the safety and effectiveness of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Milk in children (JACI 2010). In 2014, a clinical efficacy study using Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Milk was launched.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Main events in 2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In February 2015, DBV Technologies published the totality of the results for the VIPES study at the World Allergy Congress which was held in Houston, Texas.
	The detailed results of VIPES show the magnitude of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&#146;s therapeutic effect, which allow the Company to launch its third food allergy program, specifically on allergies to egg
	(Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Egg).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In April 2015, DBV Technologies announced that it had obtained breakthrough
	therapy designation from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (&#147;FDA&#148;) for Viaskin Peanut in children. 6 to 11 years of age A breakthrough therapy is defined as a product that is intended, alone or in combination with one or more other
	drugs, to treat a serious or life- threatening condition, and preliminary clinical evidence indicates that the product may demonstrate substantial improvement over existing therapies on one or more clinically significant endpoints.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June 2015, DBV Technologies announced the positive opinion of the Pediatric Committee of the European Medicines Agency (&#147;EMA&#148;) regarding the
	Pediatric Investigation Plan (&#147;PIP&#148;) of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Peanut for the treatment of children with a peanut allergy. An accepted PIP is a prerequisite for the filing for marketing
	authorization for any new medicinal product in Europe.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June 2015, subsequent to the end of Phase II, DBV Technologies also detailed the results of the
	meeting held with the FDA. The results of this meeting, which was regarding the plan to clinically develop Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Peanut, are consistent with the positive opinion previously given by
	the EMA regarding the Pediatric Investigation Plan (PIP) of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Peanut. On the basis of the compulsory consultations, in the fourth trimester of 2015, DBV Technologies plans to
	launch a worldwide Phase II clinical study on Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Peanut for the treatment of peanut allergies in children from 4 to 11 years of age (Peanut EPIT Efficacy and Safety Study PEPITES).
	On the basis of these consultations, complementary developmental plans will be discussed with the FDA during the second semester of 2015 for Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Peanut in both younger and older
	patients.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June 2015, Professor Hugh Sampson joined the Company as Scientific Director. As part of his duties, and in partnership with Professor
	Bertrand Dupont, President of the Scientific Advisory Board, Professor Sampson supervises DBV&#146;s research team and drives the development of new applications for Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	in the treatment
	of food allergies, while giving support to the Company&#146;s clinical development teams.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D168186D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In June 2015, the Company announced the end of Part A of the
	Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Milk Efficacy and Safety Phase I/II study (MILES). The Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB) for the study recommended that the study continue and expressed no safety concerns
	after evaluating the Part A safety data of subjects treated with a 150 &micro;g, 300 &micro;g and 500 &micro;g doses of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Milk.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In July 2015, the Company filed a registration statement on Form F-1 with the U.S Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;) for a proposed
	underwriter public offering of ordinary shares in the form of American Depositary Shares (&#147;ADS&#148;), as well as the registration of its Reference Document with the French Financial Markets Authority (&#147;AMF&#148;). On July&nbsp;20, 2015,
	the Company consummated the ADS offering and increased its capital in the amount of 281.5&nbsp;million US Dollars. The ADS were sold to the public at a price of 34 US dollars per ADS, which resulted in a subscription price of 61.68 Euros per new
	ordinary share (of which a share premium of 61.58 Euros). Each ADS gives the right to receive half of an ordinary share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In July 2015, the FDA accepted
	an investigator-sponsored investigational new drug (&#147;IND&#148;) application for a Phase IIA clinical trial for the potential treatment of milk-induced EoE in children using the Company&#146;s
	Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Milk. This IND acceptance enabled Dr.&nbsp;Jonathan Spergel at The Children&#146;s Hospital of Philadelphia to initiate SMILEE (Study Efficacy and Safety of the Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Milk in milk-induced Eosinophilic Esophagitis), a clinical trial designed to assess the efficacy and safety of Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	&nbsp;Milk in
	children from four to 17 years of age suffering from milk-induced EoE. The SMILEE trial was initiated in November 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In October 2015, the Company
	presented its topline findings from the first 12 months of the OLFUS-VIPES study, which follows the Phase IIb VIPES clinical study. The Company announced that t it observed that 12 additional months of therapy with Viaskin Peanut 250 &micro;g
	increased the number of patients benefiting from treatment to 70% in OLFUS-VIPES from 50% in VIPES.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In November 2015, the Company presented pre-clinical
	findings evaluating Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	technology in the context of vaccinations against respiratory syncytial virus (&#147;RSV&#148;) at the RSV Vaccines for the World 2015 meeting in La Jolla,
	California.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December 2015, the Company announced the launch of a pivot Phase III clinical trial which will evaluate the safety and efficiency of
	Viaskin
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Peanut 250&micro;g in children aged from four to 11 years of age who are allergic to peanuts. PEPITES (Peanut EPIT
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	Efficiency
	and Safety Study) is an international, double-blind, placebo-controlled Phase III study.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December 2015, the Company presented experimental results on
	the use of Epicutaneous Immunotherapy (EPIT
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	&reg;
</SUP>
	) in a model of Crohn&#146;s disease. These will be presented at the Crohn&#146;s&nbsp;&amp; Colitis Foundation of America Advances in Inflammatory
	Bowel Diseases (&#147;AIBD&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Note 2: General Information and Statement of Compliance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Preliminary remarks
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	DBV Technologies Inc. was established
	on April&nbsp;7, 2014 (the &#147;US subsidiary&#148;). The share capital of this US subsidiary is 100% owned by DBV Technologies SA (&#147;DBV Technologies&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The financial information as at December&nbsp;31, 2013 corresponds to the information previously published and includes only the transactions related to the
	parent company DBV Technologies SA, which had no equity interest in a subsidiary over the period in question.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	General principles
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The accompanying consolidated financial statements and related notes (the &#147;Financial Statements&#148;) present the operations of DBV Technologies SA and
	its US subsidiary (the &#147;Group&#148;) as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Company is a corporate venture under French law (soci&eacute;t&eacute; anonyme) and its registered office is located at 80/84 rue des Meuniers, 92220 Bagneux at
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Company moved its headquarters to 177-181 avenue Pierre Brossolette 92120 Montrouge on January&nbsp;6, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Financial
	Statements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 have been prepared under the responsibility of DBV Technologies&#146; management. The Financial Statements were approved by the Board of Directors of DBV Technologies on April&nbsp;6
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All amounts are expressed in thousands of euros, unless stated otherwise.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For consolidation purposes, both DBV Technologies SA and its subsidiary DBV Technologies Inc. have prepared individual financial statements for the period
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D168186D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Statement of Compliance
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our Financial Statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) as issued by the International
	Accounting Standard Board (&#147;IASB&#148;) and whose application is mandatory for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Comparative figures are presented for December&nbsp;31, 2013 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Due to the listing of DBV Technologies S.A. ordinary shares on the Euronext Paris and in accordance with the European Union&#146;s regulation
	No.&nbsp;1606/2002 of July&nbsp;19, 2002, the financial statements of the Group are also prepared in accordance with IFRS, as adopted by the European Union (&#147;EU&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, there are no differences in the IFRS published and mandated by the IASB and EU, with the exception of the following specific
	accounting principles which the EU has not yet adopted at the end of 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amendments to IAS 19 Defined Benefit Plans: Employee Contributions
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This amendment has not had any impact on
	the Financial Statements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As a result, the Financial Statements comply with IFRS as published by the IASB and as adopted by
	the EU.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	IFRS include International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;), International Accounting Standards (&#147;the IAS&#148;), as well as
	the interpretations issued by the Standing Interpretations Committee (&#147;the SIC&#148;), and the International Financial Reporting Interpretations Committee (&#147;IFRIC&#148;). The main accounting methods used to prepare the Financial Statements
	are described below. These methods were used for all years presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There are no new standards, amendments to standards, or interpretations applicable
	with effect on the period ending December&nbsp;31, 2015 that have an impact on the Financial Statements or on their presentation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	New and revised
	standards and amendments that may be relevant to the Company&#146;s operations but are not yet effective:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	IFRS 15 Revenue from Contracts with Customers, effective for annual periods beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 2018
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amendments to IFRS 11 Accounting for Acquisitions of Interests in Joint Operations, effective for annual periods beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 2016
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Amendments to IAS 16 and IAS 38 Clarification of Acceptable Methods of Depreciation and amortization, effective for annual periods beginning on or after January&nbsp;1, 2016
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management is in the process of evaluating the impact of these standards and amendments and is therefore, not currently able to estimate reliably the impact
	of their adoption on the Company&#146;s results on financial position or cash flows.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The accounting policies and measurement principles adopted for the
	Financial Statements as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 are the same as those used as of and for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Note 3: Accounting Principles
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Methods of
	consolidation
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Financial Statements incorporate the standalone financial statements of DBV Technologies S.A and DBV Technologies Inc. which is
	controlled by the Company. Control is achieved when the Company:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	has power over the subsidiary;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	is exposed, or has rights, to variable returns from its involvement with the subsidiary; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	has the ability to use its power to affect its returns.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company reassesses whether or not it controls a
	subsidiary if facts and circumstances indicate that there are changes to one or more of the three elements of control listed above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-11
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage156"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D168186D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Consolidation of subsidiaries begins when the Company obtains control over the subsidiary and ceases when the
	Company loses control over the subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Profit or loss and each component of other comprehensive income are attributed to the owners of the Company
	and to the non-controlling interests. Total comprehensive income of subsidiaries is attributed to the owners of the Company and to the non-controlling interests even if this results in the non-controlling interests having a deficit balance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When necessary, adjustments are made to the financial statements of subsidiaries to align their accounting policies with the Group&#146;s accounting policies.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All intragroup assets and liabilities, equity, income, expenses and cash flows relating to transactions between members of the Group are neutralized in
	consolidation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Translation of financial statements in foreign currencies
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In preparing the financial statements of each individual group entity, transactions in currencies other than the entity&#146;s functional currency are
	recognized at the rates of exchange prevailing at the dates of the transactions. At the end of each reporting period, monetary items denominated in foreign currencies are retranslated at the rates prevailing at that date. Non-monetary items carried
	at fair value that are denominated in foreign currencies are retranslated at the rates prevailing at the date when the fair value was determined.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the
	purpose of presenting these consolidated financial statements, the assets and liabilities of the Group&#146;s foreign operations are translated into Currency Units using exchange rates prevailing at the end of each reporting period. Income and
	expense items are translated at the average exchange rates at the dates of the transactions. Exchange differences arising, if any, are recognized in other comprehensive income and accumulated in equity.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	3.1 Intangible Assets
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In application of the
	provisions in IAS 38
<I>
	Intangible Assets
</I>
	(&#147;IAS 38&#148;), intangible assets acquired are recorded as assets on the Consolidated Statements of Financial Position at their acquisition cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Research and Development Expenses
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Research expenses are
	recorded in the Financial Statements as expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In accordance with IAS 38, development expenses are recorded in the Financial Statements as intangible
	assets only if all the following criteria are met:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	technical feasibility necessary for the completion of the development project;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	intention on the part of the Company to complete the project and to utilize it;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	capacity to utilize the intangible asset;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(d)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	proof of the probability of future economic benefits associated with the asset;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(e)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	availability of the technical, financial, and other resources for completing the project; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(f)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	reliable evaluation of the development expenses.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Because of the risks and uncertainties related to regulatory
	authorizations and to the research and development process, the Company believes that the six criteria stipulated by IAS 38 are only fulfilled once the Market Access Authorization has been obtained from the competent authorities.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The application of this principle has resulted in all development costs being expensed as incurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Software
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The costs related to the acquisition of
	licenses to software are posted to assets on the basis of the costs incurred to acquire and to implement the software in question.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	They are amortized
	using the straight-line method over a period of one to three years depending on the anticipated period of use.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	F-12
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D168186D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	3.2 Property, Plant, and Equipment
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Property, plant, and equipment are recorded at their acquisition cost or, if applicable, at their production cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Property, plant, and equipment are depreciated on the basis of the straight-line method over the estimated use period of the property. The fixtures of
	property rented are depreciated over the term of their own lifetime or of the term of the rental agreement, whichever is shorter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The depreciation
	periods used are the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_38"></A>

	Fixtures and improvements in structures
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	9&nbsp;years
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

	Research and development / production tools
</P>
</TD>

</P>
